synopsis.text:
Struggling through the tumultuous era of the Japanese Revolution, a young boy named Shinta is orphaned and enslaved, only to witness the brutal murder of his captors. Rescued by a mysterious samurai named Seijuro Hiko, he is given a new name - Kenshin Himura - and a chance to learn the deadly art of the Hiten-Mitsurugi-Ryuu swordsmanship.

As Kenshin grows stronger, he is torn between the ideals of justice and the harsh realities of the revolution. Despite his master's wishes, he leaves his training early to join the fight, becoming one of the most feared assassins in 19th century Japan: the Hitokiri Battousai.

Amidst the chaos and bloodshed, Kenshin encounters Tomoe, the love of his life. Yet, even as they fall in love and marry, the specter of revenge looms over their relationship.

Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan - Tsuioku-hen tells the dark and melancholic tale of a young man's struggle to protect the innocent and build a better world, even as he grapples with the weight of his own actions and the blood on his hands. Will Kenshin continue to fight, or will Tomoe's love help him sheath his bloodstained sword?
